Package classes

Class TimeCell

java.lang.Object
classes.TimeCell
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class TimeCell extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a time slot in a school timetable. It includes the time period, day of the week, and optionally the subject and class assigned to this time slot. The class also provides functionality to manage these attributes.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • TimeCell

      public TimeCell(ArrayList<LocalTime> timePeriod, String dayOfWeek)
      Constructs a TimeCell with specified time period and day of the week. Initializes the cell without a subject and class.
      Parameters:
      timePeriod - The time period of the cell.
      dayOfWeek - The day of the week for this cell.

    • TimeCell

      public TimeCell(ArrayList<LocalTime> timePeriod, String dayOfWeek, Subject subject, SchoolClass schoolClass)
      Constructs a TimeCell with specified time period, day of the week, subject, and school class.
      Parameters:
      timePeriod - The time period of the cell.
      dayOfWeek - The day of the week for this cell.
      subject - The subject scheduled in this cell.
      schoolClass - The class scheduled in this cell.

    • writeTimetable

      public static void writeTimetable(ArrayList<TimeCell> timetable)
      Writes the timetable to the standard output, displaying the schedule for each day.
      Parameters:
      timetable - The list of TimeCells representing the timetable.

    • buildEmptyTimetable

      public static ArrayList<TimeCell> buildEmptyTimetable()
      Builds an empty timetable with predefined time slots and days of the week.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of TimeCells representing the empty timetable.

    • timePeriodText

      public String timePeriodText()
      Generates a text representation of the time period.
      Returns:
      A string representing the time period in the format "HH:MM/HH:MM".
